goal.ch:
Mission statement: To help learners acquire key business communication skills through a dynamic and immersive English learning experience using various modern workplace TV series, plus corresponding book titles and case studies. 

Objective Methods: This course focuses on four aspects of the English language: speaking eloquence, listening competency, vocabulary variety, and communication technology and it aims to help students 
1. Use business TV shows to understand real-life English usage in workplace scenarios. 
2. Apply knowledge from business books and case studies to analyze show scenarios to boost critical-thinking skills for professional use. 
3. Simulate or improve how show characters handle challenges at work to enhance problem-solving abilities. 
4. Present themselves in practical tasks such as the term project “Business Pitch” to manifest what they have learned.

Expected Outcome: Upon completing the course, students will be able to strengthen their performance on tests like TOEIC and Linguaskill Business, seeking to achieve CEFR Level B2 or higher – official certification at this level can notably elevate their job prospects.

**Our lessons and evaluations commence from Week 1 for all students, whether registered or interested. Attending classes is critical to avoid credit loss.
**Language acquisition takes time and effort on a regular basis.
**Class announcements will be posted on new ee-class in due course: https://ncueeclass.ncu.edu.tw/. Students are required to follow the updates there on a weekly basis.
